section.name: 10. Using Expressions
section.p: Expressions in Cayenne are used to build query qualifiers and to perform in-memory sorting of objects. Each expression consists of a type and a set of operands. Expressions are organized by the number of operands as Unary, Binary and Ternary. Possible expression types are defined as static final int variables in Expression class. Some of the expressions have direct SQL analogues, some are specific to the Object/Relational domain. Most widely used expression types are:

ul.li:
Conditions:
LESS_THAN
GREATER_THAN
LESS_THAN_EQUAL_TO
GREATER_THAN_EQUAL_TO
BETWEEN
IN
LIKE
LIKE_IGNORE_CASE
EQUAL_TO
NOT_EQUAL_TO
NOT_IN
NOT_BETWEEN
NOT_LIKE
NOT_LIKE_IGNORE_CASE
